name: Equity Point New York @ Times Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first trip to New York and i wanted a nice hotel. Somewhere clean, safe, great location and not to basic, as it was a romantic getaway.
reviews.title: Loved Hotel 41

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a superior room (can't judge as i haven't seen the standard rooms, other than the photo's provided by other travellers) but this was definately worth the extra money we paid, something like £70 extra on the total bill. The room was clean, more than big enough and the bathroom had a nice shower. Our room was directly above the lobby looking out onto Times Square. (room 1, second floor) Never thought in a million years we would get a view in Times Square (i filled out the notes section on the booking form asking for a view) Just shows if you don't ask, you don't get!!! All the staff were really friendly and helpful and the free breakfast was really good. Selection of pastries, juice & coffee. Can't fault the cleanliness, no funny smells and strangely we heard no real noise, even though we were above the bar and facing the street. The hotel itself is just on a small sidestreet of Times Square, this worked out perfectly. You can see all the crazy action from the the hotel doors but the throngs of people don't come down by the hotel itself. I was nervous about what i would find when i got to this hotel but i wasn't disappointed. It seems like crazy money compared to what you could get at home for the same cost but that's the reality with New York, you pay alot for something basic. I wouldn't bother paying more at a fancy hotel, as you are never in your room for more than showers & sleep. I will definately be going back to Hotel 41 (Superior Room) I hope you enjoy it as much as we did.
reviews.title: Hotel 41 was perfect
Great little hotel
reviews.text: We booked a queen room arriving on Sept. 13th and staying 6 nights. Our room (401) faced the front of the hotel, had a fridge, desk, nightstand, tv/dvd, and a very nice bathroom with Aveda products. Everything in the room was spotless. The windows are amazing, when open the noise is quite loud from the street, however when shut all you heard was a horn blowing now and then. The A/C worked well .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, cleaning staff were excellent, the hotel felt very safe. The continental breakfast was enough for us.
reviews.title: Expedia users beware...

likes.liked: — location - close to everything in Midtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel was even better than I expected...hard to beat...and the subway,bus, and tours are just steps away.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, Location & Staff

reviews.text: Just returned from a stay at Hotel 41. It was a great looking hotel, both inside and outside. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The room was ok - clean and tidy but VERY small. It felt a little claustrophobic as there was only just enough room for a double bed, without luggage etc! The bathroom was nicely styled but small. Shower ok but not much pressure. The free toiletries weren't replenished during our stay at all. The breakfasts were ok quality wise, but there was very little choice available - bagels, bagels or bagels. It was a good location (just off Times Square) and VERY quiet. Overall stylish stay but not particularly good value for money.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but expensive
Great location, maybe a wee bit over priced?
reviews.text: A nice small hotel, with lovely staff. Rooms small, and having a brick wall outside your window is a bit depressing. However, I was there alone on business so perhaps spent a bit more time in the hotel than your average tourist. TV and dvd player great, although limited choice of dvds to hire, but nice touch nonetheless. Rooms very clean, nice Aveda products in the bathroom.

Breakfast a bonus, but choice very limited - small pastries and bagels. After 4 mornings I was very bored of this choice! The bar, where breakfast is served is a bit dark, although free newspaper is a good touch.
reviews.title: Shedding a little light on Hotel 41...
Small but perfectly formed!
reviews.text: Location excellent, step out of the hotel at 10pm at night and the streets around Times Square are still heaving, and the shops still open! Which is good fun! YOu can walk to lots of tourist places nearby, and the tube is at the end of the street.

reviews.title: Give this fabulous hotel a try!
reviews.text: Generally I found the hotel quiet (having a wall rather than a street outside probably helped) although I did have a room above the bar and found it very noisy until 11:30pm or so. Again, if you're a tourist rather than business traveller, you're more likely to actually be in the bar!

I stayed in this hotel for one night this summer and I have to say that in spite of the rave reviews I read here, the room was just too darn small. I had booked for two people, and in my opinion we should never have ended up in the glorified closet we were given. Even though the place is somewhat of a bargain at about $290 including tax, I would have moved somewhere else if I'd been staying more than one night. And as far as the great Times Square location goes, that is not an advantage, again, in my opinion. Too congested and noisy.
reviews.title: The room was just too small

likes.disliked: — The size of the room and the low lighting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh, and the lights in the room and tiny bathroom are maddeningly dim.
reviews.title: Good Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the plus side, that staff is very nice and the breakfast satisfying and comfortable. Good coffee.
reviews.title: Hotel 41, a hidden gem

likes.disliked: — The room was rather compact (even for Brits!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed there 8 nights. You are perfectly located in the heart of Broadway and very close from subway.
reviews.title: Perfect Location and Wonderful Staff

likes.disliked: — Rooms were smaller than we are used to.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are very small but very convenient and it should be one of the best ratio quality/price. Complimentary breakfast is enough to have a good start before a walking day, people are all nice and very helpfull. You can upgrade for various size of bed and rooms depending on your wallet. Nothing to say about cleanness, it is what you await for.
reviews.title: Love it!

reviews.text: We stayed in Oct 2004. The rooms aren't big, but then you don't go to NY to stay in your room!!. Staff great, breakfast a bonus and cocktail hour shouldn't be missed. Location great too, would book again, Neil& Ann Liverpool
reviews.title: Lovely small boutique hotel

reviews.text: We didn't do much research on New York hotels before booking this - it just looked good on the website (use your imagination for the url), and I have to say that it really was as good as it looks.
reviews.title: Brilliant value, excellent location.
What a fantastic location!
reviews.text: Some rooms are bigger than others, but the two we had (one before and one after our 8 day mini-tour of Canada) were both reasonably sized, with excellent aircon, lovely clean bathroom, and in the case of the first, a good view of the 24 hour circus that is Times Square.

The staff are friendly and helpful, the complimentary breakfast is wonderful (proper New York bagels, pastries, muffins, juice and coffee - serve yourself as many times as you like, available 7am until 11am).
reviews.title: Great Bargain, Great Location
Perfect Hotel
reviews.text: There is an entrance to the Subway straight opposite the hotel (see photos) giving access to the shuttle service to Grand Central, as well as the main North/South Manhattan lines.

reviews.title: great choice
reviews.text: The standard room was quite small, but cozy. Everything was clean and the staff were all extremely friendly and professional. If you're going to see a show on Broadway the location definately cannot be beat. We are sure to stay here again and would strongly recommend it to others.

reviews.title: Perfect Location
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel 41 for four days in July; We think we made a great choice. To start, the hotel is in the perfect location...a block from Times Square and across the street from the subway. We took the airtrain from the airport, connected to the subway at Howard Beach Station, and when we got off at 42nd Street, the hotel was literally right in front of us.

reviews.title: Loved The Hotel 41
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nightsat Hotel 41. Upon check the girl at the front desk was extremely friendly and explained they had two rooms left, a very small room on the 6th floor or a larger but still small room on the second floor, but it was right above the bar. She let take a look at the larger room and even though you could here the music from the busy bar below while walking in the hallway, you could not hear it at all in the room. We stayed in room 206.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is small - yet honestly not the smallest room I have ever stayed in. The room was spotless clean. The bedding was comfortable and the bathroom was very modern with a stand up shower. Included in the room was a small TV and DVD player. The rooms have their own climate control which was great because we could warm up the room for our return after wandering in the cold.
reviews.title: A good find

likes.disliked: — The bagels. :) TV reception wasn't the best, but we didn't watch it much.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The free breakfast is served in the bar in the morning and consist of pastries, bagels, juice, and coffee. The staff through out the hotel and bar were very helpful and friendly. Always opening doors for you and greeting you in all the common areas of the hotel.
reviews.title: loved it!

reviews.text: The location can't be beat for a short NYC trip. It's right off
reviews.title: Hotel 41: a good place for stay in NYC
Amazing Hotel in Times Square
reviews.text: Time's Square, close to chain and local resturants and coffee houses, subway right across the street and the hop on hop off bus tours stop right across the street from the hotel. You can walk to any of the Broadway shows and to Macy's.

reviews.title: Loved the friendly people!
reviews.text: Loved my stay at Hotel 41. Everyone was so warm and welcoming. The only complaint that I have is the shower in the Penthouse II. It is so high up and the water pressure isn't very good. Other than that, I loved it!

reviews.title: Great Spot
reviews.text: We have never been to NYC but took a chance on this hotel and it came out a winner. Right in the middle of everything. You have the subway across the street in front of a huge Red Lobster. Time square in just a block away and you have the port authority a block away to catch a bus back to the airport. Nice people work there and made sure we made our Broadway Show of "Rent" next door when our flight came in late.

Where do I begin? Well, having never been to New York before, we wanted a central base from which to explore (and do the obvious shopping!) I looked on Expedia to book up and the idea of a central thing went out the window when I found Hotel 41 to be one of the cheapest there...
reviews.title: Hotel 41 @ Times Square - A Perfrect Little Gem!
Awesome Experience
reviews.text: Not only was it VERY affordable, but also an amazing location... 10mins walk from Macy's, as long as it took you to get down in the lift and out the front to Times Square and the subway just outside the door! We were worried that the noise of the busy Theatre District might be too much at night but we didn't hear a sound... Needless to say, we were out all day so didn't hear anything then either!

The room, although small, was perfectly formed. Lovely fresh bed linen, a gorgeous little bathroom (the shower I could've taken home had I not bought too many jeans, trainers etc!), small TV, perfect for us as all we wanted was somewhere to call home for a few nights...
reviews.title: Very nice Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my girlfriend for the last week of April and I can give it two big thumbs up. The rooms are clean with Air-con, TV, DVD (films are free from reception), alarm clock, safe and internet access. The bed was comfy and the bathroom was clean, although the shower was a bit weak. The first night we ordered room service because we were both tired.....word of warning.....the portions are huge! We ordered starters and main and were both full after the starter.
reviews.title: Great hotel, ideal location.

reviews.text: The staff are very helpful and friendly and will offer advice on restaurants etc. and will even let you print off your boarding pass.
reviews.title: Great find!

likes.liked: — Friendly staff; great location; good price; nice updated room; comfortable bed
likes.disliked: — Open shower stalll; very high shower head, so not able to adjuste

reviews.text: The bar is nice and happy hour is from 17:00-19:00 when drinks are half price. It doubles as the breakfast room in the mornings where you can toast bagels and get fresh coffee and orange juice.
reviews.title: Just ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hope that helps to make your decision on where to stay in New York a bit easier.
reviews.title: not worth the money

reviews.text: PS - I can recommend the Stanton Social at 99 Stanton St on Ludlow and Orchard. It's very trendy and the French Onion dumplings are superb.
reviews.title: Great Staff,Great Location,ok room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can't beat the location of this hotel. Its a 2 minute walk from time square (on the quiet 41st street) so it's not too busy outside. There is a subway station opposite which is extremely handy for accessing the whole of New York.
reviews.title: Great Location! Clean Room and Polite Staff!

likes.disliked: — Price was slightly high, but not too bad.

reviews.text: We had the "Supieror" Room, at the front (6th Floor). Reasonable sized room with Cable TV and free internet access. Air Con, fridge, safe, hair dryer, ironing board, etc..
reviews.title: Great location but tiny!

reviews.text: The bathroom was extremely clean, shower was powerful which was nice!
reviews.title: Human wake-up call!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: People complain about room size at this hotel, but whats the point? If you goto New York to stay in the hotel, thats pretty sad!
reviews.title: Loved it

likes.disliked: — had to let water run a bit to get some hot water

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just wanted a great location, reasonable price and clean hotel.
reviews.title: very expencive for a minuscule room

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at Hotel 41 last week (16th - 22nd July). This hotel is great - nice rooms, great food, helpful staff but most of all what a location!! Times Square is right on your doorstep but like other people have said without the noise. We stayed in a superior room which wasn`t that small. There was enough room for both of us and our shopping and still feel very comfortable. The bed is quite small but then we are both tall, me being 5ft 10 and my boyfriend 6ft 3. The bathroom was really nice, fresh towels everyday and a great powerful shower. You also get complimentry internet access which was great as it meant I could e-mail photos to my family and keep them posted on what we were up to. The breakfast was a great statr to the day with mini danish pastries (my personal favourite), bagels, muffins, coffee and some of the nicest orange juice I`ve had. The staff are very helpful, they are there if you have a problem (which should be quite unlikely) or just to ask what to do and where to eat and drink. If your after a nice friendly hotel right on Times Square go here, you can`t go wrong!! Just one tip (especially to all you brits as I know we all like our shopping!) nothing is at face value in New York (including food and drink). There is New York State tax added at the end which is just over 8%, so bare this in mind especially with the more expensive items as this can make a difference.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed for 6 nights in July. Ok here it goes… hope this is useful…
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel in the perfect location!
Pretty Good
reviews.text: Hotel 41 is a modern boutique type hotel. Staff are all young and friendly and there is none of the uncomfortable “poshness” of some of the other New York hotels, yet service is not slack. The front door is always opened for you and you will always be wished a good day! Nothing is too much trouble for the staff who can offer excellent advice on local restaurants and amenities etc…

1) Location – incredible. You really can not ask for a better or more central location. The heart of Times Square (i.e. centre of the universe) is literally only a 30 second walk away and the hotel is down a side street just off Times Square so you don’t get any of the noise or bustle. As mentioned in other reviews there is a major subway station 20 seconds walk from the hotel which has all the main routes (N, Q, R, W, S, 1, 2, 3 & 7 lines). Turn right out of the hotel and Macy’s is a direct 10 minute stroll down the street, and the Empire State is another 10 minutes on from this. Port Authority Bus Station is a 2 minute walk (maybe less) and from here you can catch buses direct to all the major airports – this costs $15 ($27 round trip) and buses leave/arrive every 20 minutes all day. I was going to get a taxi until I found out about this service – it is so reliable and cheap I’d recommend you do this. The Rockerfeller Centre is nearby also (can’t remember how far but I recall it is only about a 20 minute walk). All this means that you can easily pop back 2 or 3 times a day just to drop off your shopping without it spoiling the day or having to go out of your way.
reviews.title: very nice
came for business and pleasure
reviews.text: 2) Rooms – after reading reviews here about the size of the rooms, I rang ahead to the hotel and upgraded to a superior room, so I can only comment on this. Note that if you book through expedia you will only get a standard room. We had room 202 which was on the front of the hotel so had a view of the street. It is my understanding not to expect good views from any of the rooms and there is at least one room whose view is directly onto a brick wall just a few inches away! Bear in mind that all you will do in the room is sleep and change so this doesn’t really matter. Our room was very clean with new sheets and towels every day. The cleaners seemed to spend at least 40 mins in each room. Air conditioning was excellent – the room was always nicely chilled. I found the room a good size with enough room to manoeuvre comfortably even with two cases and many bags of shopping on the floor (bear in mind there is no where in the room to stow away cases). There is a good sized digital safe. The bathroom was really nice and modern – all glass and white tiles with a huge mirror and good lighting. It was a good size, but there is only one small glass shelf for toiletries. A good TV and DVD player is in every room, and should you be bored there is a free DVD rental service available from the lobby. Our room was really quiet as we had no neighbours and the lobby was below. There is an iron and ironing board in every room, and the superior rooms each have a full sized fridge (left empty for your own drinks) – I don’t know if standard rooms have this. There is no mini-bar (a good thing!). People reviewing here seem to go on about the Aveda bath products that are complimentary in the bathroom, but these seemed nothing special and were just as those you get in any hotel – mini soap, shampoo, shower cap etc… Note that the beds aren’t as big as you might expect for a double – anyone who is around 6’ tall will find their feet hanging out of the bottom of the bed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THIS IS A FANTASTIC HOTEL, there was nothing we could find to complain about, staff very very friendly and helpful, room very clean with all you need, and a lovely size, we were upgraded when we arrived which was a lovely surprise, the most comfortable bed i have ever slept in which was needed after a day walking round New York shopping and sightseeing, The breakfast was perfect as well, and the location couldnt be any better right in Times Square, will be recommending this hotel to anyone who wants to go to New York.
reviews.title: Superb!!!!

reviews.text: Stayed one night on a Friday. Booked the superior room which is a little larger. Great room, neat bar off the lobby where we had a light dinner. Very friendly staff throughout and a free continental breakfast to boot. Can't beat the location in you want Times Square. Would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great little hotel

likes.liked: — Clean, friendly, location and price (for NYC)
likes.disliked: — Really nothing was negative for me

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in Hotel 41 for 4 nights and had a fantastic time. It is SO central-there is a subway just across the road and it's around the corner from Times Square. The bar in the hotel is lovely and they have "happy hour" every day from 4-7pm which is nice after a day out in New York!! Breakfast is served in the bar every morning-muffins, bagels, coffee, juice etc which fills you up til lunch. The rooms are compact but clean and the beds are really comfortable-that's all you need when you're out and about all day! The staff were so friendly. I wouldn't hesitate staying here again-it's fab! Just what you want in NYC.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from NYC and had a wonderful stay at Hotel 41. Check in was a breeze, was upgraded to a 'superior' room upon arrival. Lobby was very clean, lots of info at desk, can rent dvd's if you want. Very friendly.
reviews.title: Great Stay at Hotel 41

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, the rooms are small, but VERY clean, had everything we needed for the amount of time we actually spent in the room. We usually stay at the Hilton New York (sold out), so it was a change to be in a room so much smaller, but at the end of the day, it was fine. I would, however, be curious what a regular room was like... ours was "superior" and folks... it was small.
reviews.title: Perfect stay!

reviews.text: If you want to be at the very heart of the action, and you don't want to pay a lot for it, this is the hotel to book. (A note for first timers to New York -- Times Square is hyper, hyper active. If you'd prefer a bit of peace but still want to be in mid-town, book somewhere east of 6th Avenue.)
reviews.title: They do the basics right

reviews.text: The hotel does most of the basics right: very friendly, patient staff; decent continental breakfast; free DVDs; a lively bar. The rooms are small, but they've been intelligently laid out. And there's even a refrigerator (empty) so you have somewhere to put your drinks and snacks -- i.e., they were smart enough to figure out that you can get anything within a few yards of the hotel, so they didn't bother to put in a rip-off minibar.
reviews.title: Absolute Gem!!

reviews.text: Alas, it isn't perfect. I didn't like that the very tiny bathroom had no room to put all of my products. And, as several people pointed out, the showers have no doors, so the water tends to splash everywhere. Another quibble: the windows were open about an inch, and there seemed no way to close them. The room got pretty chilly, and I had to stuff the curtains around the windows to keep warm. (I felt guilty about raising the thermostat when the windows were open.) That seemed to do the trick.
reviews.title: Cold Water Flat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the end of my stay, I had the front desk book a car service to La Guardia. The company sent a white stretch limo! (According to the desk clerk, sometimes you get lucky.) So I left the city in style, in a car that was almost as large as my hotel room!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location

reviews.text: For my first trip to New York I really couldn't have asked for anything better.
reviews.title: A Fine Place to Stop

reviews.text: We took a mother/teenage daughter trip to NYC, and we stayed at Hotel 41 for three nights--March 11-14. I have nothing but the best to say for our room, the staff, the service, and the location. The room was plenty big for us, extremely clean, comfortable, quiet (even though we were in Times Square), had a refrigerator, and it had a safe for my daughter's laptop. The bathroom was also perfectly clean and a good size for the two of us. The robe they provided in the bathroom was so, so comfortable! It was wonderful to be able to walk downstairs each morning to get a complimentary bagel or pastry and juice so that we didn't have to take time out of the day to go out for a breakfast. I was worried about feeling safe walking back to the hotel later in the evening, but at no time did I feel uncomfortable because there were lots of people on the streets near the hotel. We were able to have our luggage locked in a room at the hotel after we checked out and until we had to leave the city. The doorman then helped with the luggage and took us to the corner to get a taxi. A+++
reviews.title: Hotel 41 is the only place we ever want to stay at in NYC!

likes.liked: — The price, location, safe feeling, cleanliness, friendly staff, complimentary breakfast, refrig & safe in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After spending five nights at Hotel 41 I can say this is the best hotel I've stayed in in New York. Having read the reviews I was expecting an extremely small room and was a bit nervous! But luckily on arrival we found the room although small had easily enough space for two and was very comfortable and cosy. In any case the staff were helpful and more than willing to accommodate our needs if we decided we'd like a larger one. The location was ideal and made it the perfect base to explore the rest of the city. I would definitely recommend this to others and would gladly go back again.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.text: We only got to stay at Hotel 41 for one night but loved it. The staff
reviews.title: We loved the Hotel 41!!

likes.liked: — The staff, espresso bar and cleanliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: was so kind and helpful. They would store our bags before and after checkout so we could spend our day in the city and not have to lug around our stuff. The rooms were clean and so cozy, plus the location
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel and Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: is awesome. We can't wait to come back!
reviews.title: Great location, great staff
Great value, friendly staff
reviews.text: I've just come back from a 6 night stay at Hotel 41, I was in NY on business. For any business travellers out there, it was very good value, and convenient for going to meetings in midtown (usually within walking distance) or directly across the street from the subway to get anywhere else very quickly. I paid $180/night through Expedia, for a standard room. The room was small, but clean, and had everything you needed, with nice Aveda products. There is no bath though, just a shower. The staff were very friendly and helpful, they let me use their adapter for my cellphone when mine didn't work. You can rent DVD's for free to watch in your room. The bar area is nice, and is actually pretty happening most of the time in the evenings. They serve good cocktails! The free breakfast is good, lots of pastries and latte/espresso if you want it as well as juice. I personally don't like the Times Square location, I fine Times Square loud and garish, but it is convenient to get to other parts of the city. Considering most business hotels are $250 minimum/night this is worth a punt if you don't mind staying in Times Square!

reviews.title: Nice Place
reviews.text: Only in town for the weekend for the Garage Fest. Hotel was clean and we felt reasonably secure in the area. As others stated the standard hotel room was small and had no view but it was clean and suited our purposes of having a clean place to stay.

Stayed at Hotel 41 for just one night 25 Feb had rooms 208 and 209, I have wanted to stay at this hotel since seeing it a few years ago on CNN. They are usually full and I end up staying at the W on the other side of Times Square.
reviews.title: Very Impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well the room is bigger than what I have ever had at the W. Everything worked well and could not be flawed. The reception was very good and helped with reservations for dinner, maps etc.
reviews.title: Hotel 41 Rocks

likes.liked: — in the middle of Times Square

reviews.title: Excellent Choice
reviews.text: Breakfast didnt offer a massive choice, but it was enough to get you going and the hot chocolate was most welcome in sub freezing NYC tempretures.
Hotel entrance is a few feet/metres from the Times Square subway with links right accross the city.
reviews.title: Low Price for Times Square

reviews.text: Great Hotel, I will always check here for availability before booking anywhere else.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Good Value

likes.liked: — Very clean rooms, internet access, great shower, excellent toiletries

reviews.title: Great Central Boutique Hotel with Breakfast!!!
reviews.text: Thanks A+K
What you get for your money here is a small, clean room with a comfortable full size bed in an A+ Times Square location. Friendly front desk - happy to print out my boarding pass.
reviews.title: We love Hotel 41!

reviews.text: my wife and i have just spent 5 nights in New York for a bit of xmas shopping and sightseeing - staying a the HOTEL 41 - 43rd/8th avenue
reviews.title: good things come in small packages
The Best!
reviews.text: we had a brilliant time - HOTEL 41 is small but perfectly placed in the heart of Times Square reasonably priced complete with splendid inclusive breakfast of Bagels orange juice/coffee and pastrys which are fresh each morning - rooms are spotless and cleaned daily - staff are extremely helpful friendly and eager to please - great city and christmas shopping is a must the lights tour is fantastic cant wait to go back

reviews.title: Great Location small room
reviews.text: So the rooms are small, who cares you're in New York. A room in New York is for sleeping. The rooms were nice, and my wife loved the Aveda Shampoo. The staff was incredible, the breakfast was great, and the free umbrella's were perfect. Hotel 41's is in a prime location with Subway access just across the street. I can't wait to stay here again!

reviews.title: Loved it!
reviews.text: I was at Hotel 41 the first weekend in December and loved it. The staff was great, the complimentary breakfast was good as was the coffee and the location is incredible. One block from the Port Authority, 7 from Macy's and Rockefeller (yes they are in opposite directions), the Times Square subway is at your door and most importantly the price lets you have more money to spend in New York.

reviews.title: Great Boutique Hotel
reviews.text: When I go back, I'll definitely be staying at the Hotel 41.
Hotel 41 was fantastic. An oasis of quiet and friendliness in Times Square. Located on 41st between 7th and 8th, it's not far from Penn Station or Times Square.
reviews.title: A Friendly Oasis

likes.disliked: — The brand of tea for breakfast (I had to think of something. It was too perfect!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was helpful and friendly. The room was small, like a hotel room in Paris might be, but impeccably clean and comfortable, with nice touches like Aveda soaps and such. A nice, simple, continental breakfast, served in the hotel's tiny bar, rounded out the stay. And the price was less expensive than other area hotels that my company recommended. If you want views, this ain't it. But that's not what I go to NYC for.
reviews.title: Central location, clean rooms and service minded staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have already written to the hotel to tell them that our next trip in, we will stay with them again.
reviews.title: good choice

reviews.text: Service minded staff, small but clean room, very close to the subway - no problem in going with subway from airport to the hotel. A nice little hotel where the staff was very kind and helped out with relevant information to get the most of the stay in NY. If you want to be in the middle of the city life - this is the place to stay :-)
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: cleanliness, location and good price are the main thing here. Located at Times Square, the center of new york, a hub to any place you want to go in Manhattan. The room was very small but spotless, nice linen and pillows. The continental breakfast is good and enough to start the morning, very attentive staff, many of them speak English and Spanish. The only thing that bother was that the A/C unit is to big for the size of the room so it is noisy at night.
reviews.title: Great .........but, WAY small

description: Contemporary boutique hotel at Times Square - 7 blocks to Jacob Javits Convention Center and Madison Square Garden.
